column4: Does anyone know how I can import all my mail and settings into evolution? (I'm using Thunderbird)
there is an import option in evolution,  under files
Yes, but that won't work seeing as Thunderbird isn't an older version of Evolution
when I tried to import my old stuff,   evolution searched for info from several clients, including thunderbird
Huh, it didn't find Thunderbird for me.
try searching the ubuntu forum for an answer
noplease  I was just butting in, I have more then enough on my plate
do you have a specific issue ?
no, I'm looking to buy a new laptop, and figured I'd make sure I could actually install Ubuntu on a Macbook if I chose to go that route.
Right-Click on Applications and choose "Edit Menus"
that only brings up the alacarte menu manager
right, and from there you can edit the menu to your heart's content

, I'm not talking about the menu , I'm talking about the wheelchair access icon in the notification area on the right side of the top panel,  it's for special access features . like magnifihying glass and such  , I uninstalled all I could think of but the icon still starts up and I can't figure out what application it is for
ah, it might be "Visual Assistance" which you can disable in System>Preferences>Sessions
already done which is why I'm so puzzled
